service: Amazon Web Services Snow Device Management documentation.

operations.CancelTask:
Sends a cancel request for a specified task. You can cancel a task only if it's still in a QUEUED state. Tasks that are already running can't be cancelled.

A task might still run if it's processed from the queue before the CancelTask operation changes the task's state.
operations.CreateTask: Instructs one or more devices to start a task, such as unlocking or rebooting.
operations.DescribeDevice: Checks device-specific information, such as the device type, software version, IP addresses, and lock status.
operations.DescribeDeviceEc2Instances: Checks the current state of the Amazon EC2 instances. The output is similar to describeDevice, but the results are sourced from the device cache in the Amazon Web Services Cloud and include a subset of the available fields.
operations.DescribeExecution: Checks the status of a remote task running on one or more target devices.
operations.DescribeTask: Checks the metadata for a given task on a device.
operations.ListDeviceResources: Returns a list of the Amazon Web Services resources available for a device. Currently, Amazon EC2 instances are the only supported resource type.
operations.ListDevices: Returns a list of all devices on your Amazon Web Services account that have Amazon Web Services Snow Device Management enabled in the Amazon Web Services Region where the command is run.
operations.ListExecutions: Returns the status of tasks for one or more target devices.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Returns a list of tags for a managed device or task.
operations.ListTasks: Returns a list of tasks that can be filtered by state.
operations.TagResource: Adds or replaces tags on a device or task.
operations.UntagResource: Removes a tag from a device or task.

AccessDeniedException.base: You don't have sufficient access to perform this action.

refs.EbsInstanceBlockDevice$deleteOnTerminati: A value that indicates whether the volume is deleted on instance termination.

Capacity.base: The physical capacity of the Amazon Web Services Snow Family device.

refs.Capacity$name: The name of the type of capacity, such as memory.

refs.Capacity$unit: The unit of measure for the type of capacity.

Command.base: The command given to the device to execute.

refs.CreateTaskInput$command: The task to be performed. Only one task is executed on a device at a time.

CpuOptions.base: The options for how a device's CPU is configured.

refs.ListDevicesOutput$devices: A list of device structures that contain information about the device.

EbsInstanceBlockDevice.base: Describes a parameter used to set up an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume in a block device mapping.

refs.InstanceBlockDeviceMapping$ebs: The parameters used to automatically set up Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volumes when the instance is launched.

refs.ListExecutionsInput$state: A structure used to filter the tasks by their current state.

ExecutionSummary.base: The summary of a task execution on a specified device.

refs.ListExecutionsOutput$executions: A list of executions. Each execution contains the task ID, the device that the task is executing on, the execution ID, and the status of the execution.

refs.CreateTaskInput$clientToken: A token ensuring that the action is called only once with the specified details.

Instance.base: The description of an instance. Currently, Amazon EC2 instances are the only supported instance type.

refs.InstanceSummary$instance: A structure containing details about the instance.

InstanceBlockDeviceMapping.base: The description of a block device mapping.

refs.Instance$blockDeviceMappings: Any block device mapping entries for the instance.

refs.DescribeDeviceEc2Input$instanceIds: A list of instance IDs associated with the managed device.

InstanceState.base: The description of the current state of an instance.

refs.DescribeDeviceEc2Output$instances: A list of structures containing information about each instance.

refs.CpuOptions$coreCount: The number of cores that the CPU can use.
refs.CpuOptions$threadsPerCore: The number of threads per core in the CPU.
refs.Instance$amiLaunchIndex: The Amazon Machine Image (AMI) launch index, which you can use to find this instance in the launch group.
refs.InstanceState$code:
The state of the instance as a 16-bit unsigned integer.

The high byte is all of the bits between 2^8 and (2^16)-1, which equals decimal values between 256 and 65,535. These numerical values are used for internal purposes and should be ignored.

The low byte is all of the bits between 2^0 and (2^8)-1, which equals decimal values between 0 and 255.

The valid values for the instance state code are all in the range of the low byte. These values are:

  • 0 : pending

  • 16 : running

  • 32 : shutting-down

  • 48 : terminated

  • 64 : stopping

  • 80 : stopped

You can ignore the high byte value by zeroing out all of the bits above 2^8 or 256 in decimal.

InternalServerException.base: An unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

refs.PhysicalNetworkInterface$ipAddressAssign: A value that describes whether the IP address is dynamic or persistent.

refs.ListDevicesInput$jobId: The ID of the job used to order the device.

refs.ListDeviceResourcesInput$type: A structure used to filter the results by type of resource.

refs.Capacity$available: The amount of capacity available for use on the device.
refs.Capacity$used: The amount of capacity used on the device.

refs.DescribeDeviceInput$managedDeviceId: The ID of the device that you are checking the information of.
refs.DescribeDeviceOutput$managedDeviceId: The ID of the device that you checked the information for.
refs.DescribeExecutionOutput$managedDeviceId: The ID of the managed device that the task is being executed on.
refs.ExecutionSummary$managedDeviceId: The ID of the managed device that the task is being executed on.
refs.ListDeviceResourcesInput$managedDeviceId: The ID of the managed device that you are listing the resources of.

refs.ListDeviceResourcesInput$maxResults: The maximum number of resources per page.
refs.ListDevicesInput$maxResults: The maximum number of devices to list per page.
refs.ListExecutionsInput$maxResults: The maximum number of tasks to list per page.
refs.ListTasksInput$maxResults: The maximum number of tasks per page.

refs.ListDeviceResourcesInput$nextToken: A pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
refs.ListDeviceResourcesOutput$nextToken: A pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
refs.ListDevicesInput$nextToken: A pagination token to continue to the next page of results.
refs.ListDevicesOutput$nextToken: A pagination token to continue to the next page of devices.
refs.ListExecutionsInput$nextToken: A pagination token to continue to the next page of tasks.
refs.ListExecutionsOutput$nextToken: A pagination token to continue to the next page of executions.
refs.ListTasksInput$nextToken: A pagination token to continue to the next page of tasks.
refs.ListTasksOutput$nextToken: A pagination token to continue to the next page of tasks.

PhysicalNetworkInterface.base: The details about the physical network interface for the device.

refs.DescribeDeviceOutput$physicalNetworkInte: The network interfaces available on the device.

Reboot.base: A structure used to reboot the device.

ResourceNotFoundException.base: The request references a resource that doesn't exist.

ResourceSummary.base: A summary of a resource available on the device.

refs.ListDeviceResourcesOutput$resources: A structure defining the resource's type, Amazon Resource Name (ARN), and ID.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.base: The request would cause a service quota to be exceeded.

SoftwareInformation.base: Information about the software on the device.

refs.CancelTaskOutput$taskId: The ID of the task that you are attempting to cancel.
refs.CreateTaskOutput$taskArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task that you created.
refs.CreateTaskOutput$taskId: The ID of the task that you created.

refs.DescribeDeviceOutput$deviceType: The type of Amazon Web Services Snow Family device.

refs.DescribeTaskOutput$taskArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task.
refs.DeviceSummary$associatedWithJob: The ID of the job used to order the device.
refs.DeviceSummary$managedDeviceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the device.

refs.Instance$privateIpAddress: The private IPv4 address assigned to the instance.
refs.Instance$publicIpAddress: The public IPv4 address assigned to the instance.
refs.Instance$rootDeviceName: The device name of the root device volume (for example, /dev/sda1).
refs.ListTagsForResourceInput$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the device or task.
refs.PhysicalNetworkInterface$netmask: The netmask used to divide the IP address into subnets.
refs.ResourceSummary$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.SoftwareInformation$installState: The state of the software that is installed or that is being installed on the device.
refs.SoftwareInformation$installedVersion: The version of the software currently installed on the device.
refs.SoftwareInformation$installingVersion: The version of the software being installed on the device.
refs.TagResourceInput$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the device or task.
refs.TaskSummary$taskArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task.
refs.UntagResourceInput$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the device or task.

refs.UntagResourceInput$tagKeys: Optional metadata that you assign to a resource. You can use tags to categorize a resource in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, or environment.

refs.DeviceSummary$tags: Optional metadata that you assign to a resource. You can use tags to categorize a resource in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, or environment.
refs.ListTagsForResourceOutput$tags: The list of tags for the device or task.
refs.TagResourceInput$tags: Optional metadata that you assign to a resource. You can use tags to categorize a resource in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, or environment.
refs.TaskSummary$tags: Optional metadata that you assign to a resource. You can use tags to categorize a resource in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, or environment.

refs.DescribeTaskOutput$targets: The managed devices that the task was sent to.

refs.CreateTaskInput$description: A description of the task and its targets.
refs.DescribeTaskOutput$description: The description provided of the task and managed devices.

refs.CancelTaskInput$taskId: The ID of the task that you are attempting to cancel. You can retrieve a task ID by using the ListTasks operation.
refs.DescribeExecutionInput$taskId: The ID of the task that the action is describing.
refs.DescribeExecutionOutput$taskId: The ID of the task being executed on the device.
refs.DescribeTaskInput$taskId: The ID of the task to be described.

refs.ListTasksInput$state: A structure used to filter the list of tasks.
refs.TaskSummary$state: The state of the task assigned to one or many devices.

TaskSummary.base: Information about the task assigned to one or many devices.

refs.ListTasksOutput$tasks: A list of task structures containing details about each task.

ThrottlingException.base: The request was denied due to request throttling.

refs.DescribeDeviceOutput$lastReachedOutAt: When the device last contacted the Amazon Web Services Cloud. Indicates that the device is online.
refs.DescribeDeviceOutput$lastUpdatedAt: When the device last pushed an update to the Amazon Web Services Cloud. Indicates when the device cache was refreshed.
refs.DescribeExecutionOutput$lastUpdatedAt: When the status of the execution was last updated.
refs.DescribeTaskOutput$lastUpdatedAt: When the state of the task was last updated.
refs.InstanceSummary$lastUpdatedAt: When the instance summary was last updated.

Unlock.base: A structure used to unlock a device.

ValidationException.base: The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an Amazon Web Services service.
